intro: Securidaca cumingii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
